In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages : 'We're working on that.'

The exact operation of the Longsleep cryotube remains a commercial secret, with {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} merely licensing the design. Able to regenerate organ damage when supplied with power and an atmosphere, the Longsleep is a minor miracle of modern medical technology.

Daylight sensors provide data on whether the current region of your base is in sunlight, and report the exact solar angle. Note that the orientation of the sensor alters the reported solar angle, while {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems can be used to offset it.
The digital valve allows {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} to create {LINK:LogicPage;logic-controlled} valves and pipe networks.

Capable of manufacturing a vast array of items, the {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} General Fabricator was considered too risky by the {LINK:ODA;ODA} for widespread use. Certainly, it has been used for purposes beyond those it was intended, including counterfeiting, terrorism, and bad art. As a result, its deployment is now heavily regulated.

Few objects or ideas are as clearly and transparently named as the Flashing Light, although fans of scrupulous accuracy have been known to refer to it by its full, official title : 'Default Yellow Flashing Light'.

More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also have several variations for more complex constructions, such as the {THING:StructureFrameCorner} and {THING:StructureFrameCornerCut}. Like iron frames, they are placed then completed by welding {THING:ItemSteelSheets} to the open framework.

More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also offer several variations for more complex lattice constructions. With a little patience and maneuvering, the corner frame's Gothic-inspired silhouette allows the creation of ogival arches and even more ambitious architecture, although they are not airtight and cannot be built on.
More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also provide variations for more ornate constructions.

Le four Zhurong utilise un mélange de gaz haute température composé d'{GAS:Oxygen} et de {GAS:Volatiles} pour fondre des lingots ainsi qu'une variété d'alliages en tant que matières premières pour les imprimantes.
Un mélange de gaz de base peut être obtenu en ajoutant {THING:ItemOxite} et {THING:ItemVolatiles} dans un rapport de 1:2 directement dans le four, mais pour les alliages plus complexes, il faudra gérer avec précaution un réseau de mélange de gaz dédié. Les rapports précis des ingrédients doivent être respectés. De même, la fusion des minerais à des températures insuffisantes produira des mélanges de réactifs, qui devront être recyclés.
Si des liquides sont présents dans le four, ils s'accumuleront là jusqu'à ce que le four soit connecté à un réseau de tuyaux de liquide.
Indispensable pour produire des ratios atmosphériques précis, ce mélangeur de gaz combine deux gaz dans des proportions pouvant varier de 0 à 100%.
Gas sensors are designed to monitor and report basic atmospheric information, including temperature, pressure, and gas ratios. They also make wonderful wedding presents.
When connected to a pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}.

When connected to a liquid pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}. It will not accept gas canisters.

The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics tray is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}.
It gets the party started. Especially if that party is an explosive gas mixture.
If a tidy base is the sign of a ordered mind, lockers are the righteous post upon which that sign hangs.

Originally developed to monitor dance marathons, the motion sensor can also be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems for security purposes, automatic lighting, doors and various other applications. The sensor activates whenever a player enters the grid it is placed on.

Passive vents allow gases to move into and out of pipe networks, which are closed systems unless connected to a device or structure. Passive vents are not powered, merely an aperture, essentially turning an enclosed space into part of the pipe network.

Allegedly the outcome of a weekend father-daughter electronics project by an overzealous {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} engineer, the pipe analyzer is essentially a more advanced version of the {THING:StructurePipeMeter}. Displaying the internal pressure of pipe networks, it also reads out temperature and gas contents, and can be connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} or {THING:StructureComputer} via a {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} system.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.
As its perspicacious name suggests, the pipe label is designed to be attached to a straight stretch of pipe. Users can then label the label with the {THING:ItemLabeller}.

While the Stationeers program has, thus far, inspired little in the way of classical poetry, the following haiku was found etched, ironically, on a piece of pipe wreckage found on Vulcan : "Humble pipe meter speaks the truth, transmits pressure within any pipe"

A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added the gas within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the gas in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.
Attaches a {THING:ItemKitDynamicGenerator} to a power network.

Controlling the flow of gas between two pipe networks, pressure regulators shift gas until a set pressure on the outlet side is achieved, or the gas supply is exhausted. The back pressure regulator, by contrast, will only operate when pressure on the intake side exceeds the set value. With a max pressure of over 20,000kPa, it requires power to operate.
"Safety third."

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's} standard solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight. They can be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

No amount of automation is complete without some way of moving different items to different parts of a system. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} A2B sorter can be programmed via a computer with a {THING:MotherboardSorter} to direct various items into different chute networks. Filtered items are always passed out the righthand side of the sorter, while non filtered items continue straight through.

A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.

A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The reversed stacker has power and data on the opposite side. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.

As tidy as it is useful, the suit storage rack holds an {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} and a {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}. When powered and connected to {THING:Oxygen} and {THING:Propellant}, it will recharge the suit's batteries, refill the {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} and your {THING:ItemGasFilterNitrogen} {SLOT:GasCanister}. The wastetank will be pumped out to the pipe connected to the waste outlet. All the rack's pipes must be connected or the unit will show an error state, but it will still charge the battery.
Tank connectors are basic mounting devices that allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterEmpty} to a gas pipe network.
These basic mounting devices allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty} to a liquid pipe network.
The volume pump pumps pumpable gases. It also separates out pipe networks into separate networks.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Freezy Boi wall cooler complements the wall heater, which can only raise the temperature. The wall cooler functions by drawing heat from the surrounding atmosphere and adding that heat into its pipe network. In order to run the wall cooler properly, you will need to connect pipes to the wall cooler and fill the connected pipe network with any type of gas. The gas's heat capacity and volume will determine how fast it reacts to temperature changes.
{HEADER:EFFICIENCY} The higher the difference in temperature between the gas stored in the pipes and the room, the less efficient the wall cooler will be. So to keep the wall cooler running at an acceptable efficiency you will need to get rid of the heat that accumulates in the pipes connected to it. A common practice would be to run the pipes to the outside and use radiators on the outside section of the pipes to get rid of the heat. The less efficient the wall cooler, the less power it consumes. It will consume 1010W at max efficiency. The wall cooler can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain degree. {HEADER:ERRORS} If the wall cooler is flashing an error then it is missing one of the following :
- Pipe connection to the wall cooler. - Gas in the connected pipes, or pressure is too low. - Atmosphere in the surrounding environment or pressure is too low.
For more information about how to control temperatures, consult the {LINK:TemperatureControlPage;temperature control} Guides page.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} wall heater is a simple device that can be installed on a wall or frame and connected to power. When switched on, it will start heating the surrounding environment. It consumes 1010W of power and can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain level.

The mainstay of power generation for Stationeers, this device provides 20kW of power. Multiple solid resources can be loaded. While operating, the device will output its maximum power regardless of whether you have captured it or not. Watch for blown wires! It will output much more power than your regular {THING:ItemCableCoil} can handle.

The large {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} transformer is a critical component of extended {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} networks, controlling the maximum power that will flow down a cable. To prevent overloading, output can be set from 0 to 50,000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.
Chute's with windows let you see what's passing through your {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} network. But be warned, they are not insulated as other chutes are. Ices will melt.

The simplest smelting system available to the average {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}, {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} arc furnace was forged itself in the depths of the Solar System to help explorational geologists determine the purity of potential asteroidal mining targets. Co-opted by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}, it now provides Stationeers with a way to produce pure ingots of various resources. The smelting process also releases a range of by product {LINK:GasPage;gases}, principally {GAS:Nitrogen}, {GAS:CarbonDioxide}, {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen} in differing ratios. These can be recaptured from the atmosphere by filtering, but also make the arc furnace a risk in closed environments. Unlike the more advanced {THING:StructureFurnace}, the arc furnace cannot create {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

The foundation of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} fabrication systems, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autolathe is a multi-axis molecular compositional system. Its complexity demands considerable time to assemble, but it remains an indispensable creation tool. Upgrade the device using a {THING:AutolathePrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
Use heavy cable coil for power systems with large draws. Unlike {THING:StructureCableCoil}, which can only safely conduct 5kW, heavy cables can transmit up to 100kW.

Silver is a chemical element with the symbol "Ag". Valued by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for its attractive luster and sheen, it is also used in a variety of {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronics} components and {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

Nickel is a chemical element with the symbol "Ni" and is a rare metal commonly used as a plating to prevent corrosion. Sought after by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}, Nickel is also commonly used to create several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

Lead is a chemical element with the symbol "Pb". It is a dense, heavy metal with a low melting point. Lead is a used to make a variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;alloys} like {THING:ItemSolderIngot} and munitions.
Soybeans grow at a moderate rate, but require atmospheric {GAS:Nitrogen} to grow. Its main use is to create {THING:ItemSoyOil}
Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder.

Silicon is a chemical element with the symbol "Si" and is one of the most useful elements to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}. Readily available throughout the universe, silicon is used in a range of {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}, glass, plastics and various electronic components a Stationeer may need to complete their mission.

There was a time, when Stationeers had to make {THING:ReagentFenoxitone} using the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor}. Recent advances in technology allow you to use equivalent quantities of fern directly in recipes.
Sustains, without decay. If only all our relationships were so well balanced.

The electronic printer will create any {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronic} part you need. From circuit boards and electronic devices to solar panels. The choice is yours. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ElectronicPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

An extremely reactive ice with numerous hydrocarbons trapped inside. For simplicity's sake, these are often displayed as H2 by devices like the {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}.
Volatiles combust in a 2:1 ratio with {GAS:Oxygen}, creating {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and pollutants. However when catalysed via devices such as the {THING:H2Combustor} in the presence of {GAS:Oxygen}, they produce {GAS:Steam} and heat with a modicum of {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and {GAS:Pollutant} due to the autoignition of the volatiles in the chamber. Along with {GAS:Oxygen}, volatiles gas is also the major component of fuel for such devices as the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch}.

Oxite ice is largely composed of frozen {GAS:Oxygen}, and found on many planets in the Solar System. Highly valuable and sought after, not all planets a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} visits will have some.
Highly sensitive to temperature, oxite will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}. When melting, oxite produces a mixture of {GAS:Oxygen} and {GAS:Nitrogen}.

A go-to tool for all your atmospheric and plumbing needs, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Atmoprinter will create everything from pipes, pumps and tanks, to vents and filters, ensuring your survival in any environment. Upgrade the Atmoprinter using a {THING:PipeBenderMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

No mission can be completed without the proper tools. The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} ThuulDek manufactory can fabricate almost any tool or hand-held device a {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} may need to complete their mission, as well as a variety of delightful paints. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ToolPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} dual solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight, with dedicated data and power ports. They can be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

A device for collecting the raw resources while destroying an item. Produces {THING:ItemReagentMix} containing packages of reagents. Pass these through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to gain back the source ores. Plants and organic matter passed through will create Biomass, which when passed through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} will produce {THING:ItemBiomass}.
An assignable dial with up to 1000 modes.
Potatoes are a simple, fast growing crop that can keep Stationeers alive in emergencies.
Tomato plants are perennial, and will produce multiple harvests without needing to be replanted. Once the plant is mature, it will fruit at a moderate pace.

Le Radar Souterrain {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, lorsqu'il est utilisé en conjonction avec soit une {THING:CartridgeOreScanner} soit une {THING:CartridgeOreScannerColor} insérée dans une {THING:ItemTablet}, permet à un {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} de maximiser les rendements de minage et d'économiser du temps en collectant les ressources nécessaires à l'accomplissement de leur mission en affichant les minerais cachés dans le terrain.
Insérez une Carte (Scanneur de minéral) dans la tablette, puis appuyez sur le bouton d'activation du Radar Souterrain pour scanner les environs. Les données seront affichées sur la tablette.
When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground on the tablet.
Made using {THING:ItemCookedTomato}s and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}.

RecordThing.Value: Revêtement Composite (Coin Long incliné en miroir)

RecordThing.Description: Please note, the organics printer has been deprecated - it is now spawnable in Creative mode only.

Any {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} concerned about security needs the {LINK:Harkwell;Harkwell-designed} Vigilant-E security printer. Use the Vigilant-E to create a {THING:CartridgeAccessController}, in order to restrict access to different parts of your base via keycards like the {THING:AccessCardBlue}. The printer also makes a variety of weapons and ammunitions to defend your base against any hostile, aggressive or just slightly rude entites you encounter as you explore the Solar System.

The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} Electrolyzer splits {GAS:Water} into hydrogen and {GAS:Oxygen}. Employing unknown proprietary technology, the device uses water's latent heat as the energy to drive the electrosis process. If there is a downside to this near-miraculous fission, it's that the device is limited by the quantity of power available, which is used to maintain the temperature output. In other words, the machine works best with hot gas.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo-designed} 'Slot Mate' vending machine allows storage of almost any item, while also operating as a distribution point for working with {LINK:TradingPage;Traders}. You cannot trade without a vending machine, or its more advanced equivalent, the {THING:StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine}. Each vending machine can hold up to 100 stacks.
The Hardsuit Helmet is similar to the {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, but can withstand higher temperatures and pressures. It's perfect for enduring harsh environments like Venus and Vulcan.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Re :Gurge is a handy unit for unloading any items inserted into it, and feeding them into a chute network. For instance, if you add a full {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, the Re :Gurge will empty a mining belt of its contents, insert them into the chute network, then insert the mining belt itself. A {THING:StructureSorter} is recommended to reclaim the mining belt.
Output = 0 exporting the main item Output = 1 exporting items inside and eventually the main item.
Effectively deprecated. Use {THING:ItemFern} directly.
This kit produces a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty}.
A tasty food item. Unlike normal plants, it consumes {GAS:Oxygen} and outputs {GAS:CarbonDioxide}. Mushrooms will only mature at a moderate rate in darkness, and prolonged light will kill it.
Pumpkins are a perennial plant, with both a long growth time, and a long time between harvests. Its low requirement for darkness allows for accelerated growing if provided with extra light.
Rice grows at a moderate rate as long as its supplied with plenty of water. Being more dependant on water, rice plants can easily die during periods of drought.
This backpack can be useful when you are working inside and don't need to fly around.

The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack at all, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. The hardsuit jetpack is capable of much higher speeds than the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} - up to 15m/s. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has fourteen storage slots. USE : 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
Klaxons allow you to play over 50 announcements and sounds, depending on your {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} set-up. Set the mode to select the output.

When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground in different colors on the tablet.
Iron and Nickle = red Ice, Lead, Cobalt = cyan Gold and Silver = green Coal and Silicon = magenta Copper and Oxite = yellow Volatiles and Uranium = white

When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer}, the IC Editor allows players to write and edit IC code, which can then be uploaded to a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} if housed in an {THING:StructureCircuitHousing}.

Landing pad capable of handling a small trade shuttle. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} enables the ability to trade with suppliers. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.

This medium communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.

When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer} and connected to a {THING:Landingpad_DataConnectionPiece}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust the horizontal and vertical attributes of the {THING:StructureSatelliteDish} either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader. A minimum of a 3x3 clear pad area with a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01} at the center is required for a trader to land.

Sometimes mining trips require something a little bigger to bring home the goods. This scaled up version of the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Topo' design {THING:ItemMiningDrill} can literally move mountains. The heavy mining drill will remove more ground and mine {LINK:OrePage;ore} more quickly than the standard mining drill. The heavy mining drill is also resilient to temperature and pressure. So no matter what planet or extreme weather conditions may be present, the Recurso heavy mining drill will get the job done.
Not spawnable.
Used for generating power from sunlight. Efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair it using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

Designed by - presumably drunk - {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} roboticists, AIMeE (or Automated Independent Mechanical Entity) can be a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} best friend, or tiresome nemesis, or both several times in the same day.
Intended to unearth and retrieve ores automatically, the unit requires basic programming knowledge to operate, and {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip}.
AIMEe has 7 modes :
RobotMode.None = 0 = Do nothing RobotMode.None = 1 = Follow nearest player RobotMode.None = 2 = Move to target in straight line RobotMode.None = 3 = Wander around looking for ores in 15 co-ords radius RobotMode.None = 4 = Unload in chute input or chute bin within 3 meters / 1.5 large grids RobotMode.None = 5 = Path(find) to target RobotMode.None = 6 = Automatic assigned state, shows when storage slots are full
The advanced furnace comes with integrated inlet and outlet pumps for controlling the unit's internal pressure.

Due to the original Stationeer manual collapsing into a singularity, Astroloy recipes have been warped by spacetime contortions. The correct Astroloy recipe, as memorialized for all time in a series of charming plastic icons, is 1.0 Copper, 1.0 Cobalt, and 2.0 Steel.

Cobalt is a chemical element with the symbol "Co" and is typically found in only small deposits. Cobalt is a rare substance, but used create the {THING:ItemHealPill} and several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

RecordThing.Value: Revêtement Composite (Coin incliné intérieur Long D)
Revêtement Composite (Coin incliné intérieur Long G)

RecordThing.Description: Apply to an {THING:StructureElectronicsPrinter} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureAutolathe} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureToolManufactory} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a sub-network of cables, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a sub-network of cables, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

The basic {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stabilizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE : 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'ZQSD' to move.

Cadre photo (Paysage, cadre fin, bordure blanche, petite taille)

RecordThing.Description: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} SquareDig autominer is a structure that when built will mine a vertical 2x2 shaft until it hits bedrock. The autominer can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the autominer outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area.

A container the will fill with Dirt when using a {THING:ItemMiningDrill} when placed inside a {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. You can then use this {SLOT:DirtCanister} with the {THING:ItemTerrainManipulator} to adjust the terrain to suit your needs.

The cargo module has capacity for two ten-slot crates. You can have multiple cargo modules on your rocket. The rocket can lift up to seven modules in total. This cargo will be released in orbit and descend the surface of your destination. Unless that happens to be the asteroid belt, in which case it will be left floating serenely in the void.

The command module must be placed on top of the rocket, and will assess the rocket’s readiness for flight. Once all conditions are met, the rocket can be launched when all players are seated in the module by pressing ‘IGNITION’ on the console.
The following conditions must be met for launch :
- Fuel full - Fuel mix ratio correct - a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. - All players seated - Power supplied to the {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Fully built rocket
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. When landing, the rocket will deploy a lander, and any cargo contained in the {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01} module.

RecordThing.Value: Module dynamique de commande de Fusée

RecordThing.Description: Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.

La tablette avancée {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Padi 2 est une version améliorée de la tablette de base {THING:ItemTablet}, offrant deux emplacements pour {LINK:CartridgePage;cartouches}. Le Padi 2 accepte les {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, ainsi que diverses autres cartouches. Avec un {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} dans le {SLOT:ProgrammableChip}, vous pouvez accéder aux emplacements variables sur le porteur humain en utilisant les numéros de périphériques (d0, d1, etc...), tant que l'objet peut être accédé via la logique, comme le {THING:ItemHardSuit}.
This kit produces varieties of {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, which greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
The modular rocket engine is capable of lifting up to seven modules, including itself. It must be fueled by at least one {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

The rocket fueltank requires a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. If the mixture exceeds these proportions, or you place other {LINK:GasPage;gases} in the tank, the {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console will display an ‘Invalid’ error.
Note that the rocket fueltank can also be used to collect gas mined by the {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}, when connected to that unit by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLaunchPad}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketEngine01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

The pipe organ can be attached to one end of a {THING:ItemPipeValve}. The length of the pipe after the pipe organ changes the pitch of the note it will play when the valve is opened. Use {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} to open and close the valves to create some custom tunes for your base or an audible warning.
Creates a {THING:StructurePipeOrgan}.
The Sensor Processing unit can be inserted into {THING:ItemSensorLenses} to reveal underground minerals in a HUD.

These {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} glasses might not be the most fashionable thing, but when a {THING:ItemSensorProcessingUnitOreScanner} is inserted, Stationeers can use these handy glasses to x-ray the ground and find ores that are hidden beneath the surface.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight. They lie flat to the ground, and their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight, sitting at 45 degrees to the ground. Their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
This kit creates a standing solar panel.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.
Place a respawn point to set a player entry point to your base when loading in, or returning from the dead.
Creates a {THING:Rover_MkI}

{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.
This kit produces an {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} {THING:StructureGrowLight}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureUprightWindTurbine}.

Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.

A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Nv2 is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Nv2 is about as safe as luggage gets.
This kit produces a {THING:CrateMkII}.

Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Made using {THING:ItemCookedPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}

Made using {THING:ItemCookedCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Faily high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.

The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with {GAS:Water} using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.

Charcoal is a lightweight, black carbon residue produced by heating {THING:ItemBiomass} in a {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. It contains less energy potential than {THING:ItemCoalOre}, but can be used as a basic fuel source. Charcoal can also be substituted for coal in {LINK:IngotPage;alloy} recipes.
This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
The Nv2 mining belt is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.

The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureWindTurbine}.
This kit produces a range of liquid pipes.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state : liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state : liquid.

It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state : liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state : liquid.
Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.
As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.

The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective {LINK:GasPage;gases} and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either outlet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureIceCrusher}.
An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, you are able to store water in this {SLOT:GasCanister} without them gaining or losing temperature.

A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added to the liquid within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.
An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, for storing liquids without them gaining or losing temperature.
Regulates the volume ratio of liquid in the output Liquid pipe. This is expressed as percentage where 100 is totally full and 0 is empty.

This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definitely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units. The Nv2 is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder. The Nv2 is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise. The Nv2 is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.

The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modeled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.' The Nv2 is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.

One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures} The Nv2 is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself : put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

RecordThing.Value: Module de stockage de liquide de fusée autonome
Module de silo de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous silo module provides storage for {LINK:OrePage;ores} collected by the {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}, {LINK:OrePage;ices} collected by the {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining} and 'space junk' salvaged by the {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining} . In other words, it holds up to 600 'medium-sized dry goods'. The silo module must be connected to a mining or salvage module by a correctly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for material to pass into the silo. The silo module must also be powered when on the launch pad. It is 'on' by default, but can be turned off with logic if needed. The module can also be attached to a {THING:StructureChuteInlet} in order to connect it to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. To extract resources from the silo module, you must set its state to 'OPEN' using logic.

RecordThing.Value: Module de stockage d'énergie de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: Coming soon

RecordThing.Value: Module de collecte des gaz de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: Collects gas from space by magic.

RecordThing.Value: Module de collecte d'énergie de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: Collects energy by electromagnetically capturing the solar wind. Stores it in the {THING:StructureRocketModuleBattery}. Coming soon

The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

RecordThing.Value: Module d'extraction de minerai de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous {LINK:OrePage;ore} miner harvests metallic ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).

RecordThing.Value: Module récolteur de liquide de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: Coming soon
The automation module completes the rocket. It passes logic to its respective components.

RecordThing.Value: Module de couplage de fusée autonome (bas)
RecordThing.Description: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed BELOW a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the DOWN coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

RecordThing.Value: Module de couplage de fusée autonome (Haut)
RecordThing.Description: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed ABOVE a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the UP coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module de silo de fusée autonome)
RecordThing.Description: Creates a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}.

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module de couplage de fusée autonome)
RecordThing.Description: Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}
Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketAutomation}

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module d'extraction de minerai de fusée autonome)
RecordThing.Description: Creates a {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}.

RecordThing.Value: Module d'extraction de glace de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous ice miner is a purpose-built, robotic ice harvester, able to mine ice ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much ice {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module d'extraction de glace de fusée autonome)
RecordThing.Description: Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining}.

RecordThing.Value: Module de récupération de fusée autonome
RecordThing.Description: The so-called {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'space junk' collector module is really a high-end automated salvaging unit, purpose designed to interface with the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous rocket. It sweeps the local region of space for wrecks, abandoned space shipments, and other detritus. As such, it returns a fairly random assortment of items. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module de récupération de fusée automatisée)
RecordThing.Description: Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining}.

L'analyseur génétique peut être utilisé pour traiter des échantillons du {THING:ItemPlantSampler}. Une fois traitées, les informations génétiques de la plante échantillonnée peuvent être consultées en cliquant sur le bouton de recherche.
Widgets de valeur génétique individuelle : La plupart des valeurs de gène apparaîtront sous la forme d'une barre coulissante entre une valeur minimale à gauche et une valeur maximale à droite. La valeur réelle du gène est au milieu de la barre, en orange.
Widgets de valeurs génétiques multiples : Pour les plages de température et de pression, quatre gènes apparaissent sur le même widget. Les valeurs orange sous la barre sont les seuils minimum et maximum de croissance. En dehors de cette plage, la plante cessera de croître et finira par mourir. Les valeurs bleues sous la barre sont les seuils minimum et maximum pour une croissance idéale. À l'intérieur de cette plage, la plante poussera à la vitesse maximale. Les valeurs blanches au-dessus de la barre sont les valeurs minimales et maximales réalisables pour le seuil de croissance.

Le stabilisateur génétique peut être utilisé pour manipuler la stabilité des gènes sur une {LINK:OrganicPage;Plants} ou {LINK:OrganicPage;Seeds} spécifique. Il a deux modes Stabiliser et Déstabiliser. Stabiliser : Augmente la stabilité de tous les gènes de 50 %. Déstabiliser : Diminue la stabilité de tous les gènes de 10 %, à l'exception d'un gène choisi qui recevra une stabilité réduite de 50 %.

L'épisseur génétique végétal peut être utilisé pour copier un seul {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} d'une plante 'source' vers une autre plante 'cible' du même type. Après la copie, la plante source sera détruite.
Pour commencer l'épissage, placez une plante ou un sac de graines dans la fente de gauche (source) et placez une autre plante ou un sac de graines du même type dans la fente de droite (cible). Vous pouvez sélectionner un gène à l'aide des boutons fléchés. Fermez la porte coulissante et appuyez sur le bouton d'activation vert. Une fois l'épissage commencé, l'appareil sera verrouillé jusqu'à ce que le processus soit terminé (ce qui prendra environ vingt minutes). Si vous souhaitez annuler l'épissage, vous pouvez éteindre le banc ou détacher l'appareil en dernier recours.

L'échantillonneur de plantes vous permet de prélever un échantillon {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} d'une plante en croissance. L'échantillonneur peut ensuite être placé dans le {THING:AppliancePlantGeneticAnalyzer} pour atteindre et interpréter les résultats.

Cette citerne portable stocke des liquides, et uniquement des liquides. Vous pouvez le boulonner à un {THING:ItemTankConnectorLiquid} en utilisant une {THING:ItemWrench}, puis le connecter à un réseau de tuyaux pour le remplir. Vous pouvez remplir une {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater} en la fixant à la section rayée du réservoir. Ou vous pourriez l'attacher à une fusée à l'aide d'une {THING:ItemWrench} et l'emmener quelque part éloigné et sec, puis vous sentir bien avec vous-même.
Contient {GAS:Water}, si vous en avez.
Répare les HEM-Droids endommagés à leur pleine santé.
Une batterie consommable qui recharge votre batterie de combinaison. Si elle est utilisée sur un HEM-Droid, elle rechargera la batterie interne du HEM-Droid.
Ce kit produit un seul {THING:StructureGyroscope}.
Une délicieuse collation semi-santé, rien ne réconforte un {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} situé à 800 millions de kilomètres de la maison comme un muffin fait maison.
Ce kit crée ce miracle de la science moderne, un {THING:ItemRTG}.
Ce kit crée un {THING:ItemRTGSurvival}.

Permet l'évacuation du gaz propulseur et des liquides évaporés d'un tuyau de liquide. Similaire en fonction à un régulateur de pression en contre-courant, le {THING:StructurePurgeValve} déplace le gaz du tuyau de liquide d'entrée vers le tuyau de gaz de sortie afin de maintenir la pression de l'entrée au niveau cible.
Pousse le gaz dans un tuyau de liquide pour augmenter la pression.
Permet l'évacuation de liquides d'un tuyau de gaz vers un tuyau de liquide. Ne permet aux liquides de passer que dans une direction.

Permet le transfert de liquides d'un tuyau de liquide vers un tuyau de gaz. Ne permet aux liquides de passer que dans une direction. Cela est généralement fait pour permettre au liquide de s'évaporer dans un gaz dans le cadre d'une boucle de climatisation.

Offrant un stockage d'énergie à grande échelle et fiable, la batterie de station {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Dianzi' est le cœur de la plupart des bases {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}. Il existe diverses précautions pour la conception de systèmes électriques utilisant des batteries, et chaque stationnaire expérimenté a une histoire à raconter, d'où l'adage des stationnaires : 'Dianzi cuit, mais il brûle aussi.' {HEADER:POWER OUTPUT} Capable de stocker jusqu'à 3 600 000 Watts d'énergie, il n'y a pas de limites pratiques à son débit, il est donc sage d'utiliser {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Les ingénieurs électriciens chevronnés riront également de ceux qui ne parviennent pas à séparer leurs réseaux de génération d'énergie à l'aide d'un {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} et d'un {THING:StructureTransformer}.

Cette boîte de contrôle {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} gère les dispositifs tels que le {THING:StructureActiveVent}, le {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, le {THING:StructureGasSensor} et la {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, en fonction du {LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard} inséré dans l'unité. Il dispose d'un port de données/alimentation partagé. Une console complète affiche tous les appareils connectés au réseau électrique actuel. Tous les appareils non liés à la carte de circuit installée seront grisés et inutilisables. Les consoles sont verrouillées une fois qu'un {THING:ItemDataDisk} est retiré.

L'unité de filtration est basée sur un ancien système {LINK:ExMin;ExMin}, lui-même basé sur des conceptions plus anciennes d'origine incertaine. Elle est disponible dans le {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}. Le dispositif s'est néanmoins révélé indispensable pour les systèmes atmosphériques des {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}, car il peut filtrer deux {LINK:GasPage;gases} simultanément à partir d'un seul réseau de tuyaux à l'aide d'un réseau de filtres doubles. L'unité dispose d'une entrée et d'une sortie de filtre, ainsi que d'une sortie non filtrée pour les gaz résiduels.
Un élément d'une ancienne classe de vaisseau spatial, le gyroscope permettait à ces véhicules de tourner dans au moins l'une des directions les plus populaires de l'univers.

Le RTG ({LINK:Norsec;Norsec} générateur thermoélectrique à radio-isotopes) utilise la chaleur générée par la désintégration radioactive pour produire une tension grâce à une différence de température à travers un thermocouple. Normalement limité aux dispositifs à faible énergie, on dit que le RTG exploite l'ingénierie Zrillienne pour atteindre sa sortie d'énergie incroyablement élevée.

Le majestueux silo contient de grandes quantités de presque tout. Pendant qu'il fait cela, il ne peut pas être déconstruit. Notez également que toute nourriture que vous mettez dans un silo a tendance à se {LINK:DecayPage;decay} extrêmement rapidement. Le silo peut contenir jusqu'à 600 piles.
Ce kit crée un {THING:StructureSDBSilo}.
Module de porte 1 x 2 pour construire des portes de hangar.
Module de porte 1 x 3 pour construire des portes de hangar.

Offrant un stockage d'énergie à grande échelle et fiable encore meilleur que la {THING;StructureBattery}, la batterie de station grande {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Da Dianchi' est le cœur de la plupart des bases {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}. Il existe diverses précautions pour la conception de systèmes électriques utilisant des batteries, et chaque stationnaire expérimenté a une histoire à raconter, d'où l'adage des stationnaires : 'Dianzi cuit, mais il brûle aussi.' {HEADER:PRODUCTION D'ÉNERGIE} Capable de stocker jusqu'à 9 000 001 watts d'énergie, il n'y a pas de limites pratiques à son débit, il est donc sage d'utiliser {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Les ingénieurs électriciens chevronnés riront également de ceux qui ne parviennent pas à séparer leurs réseaux de génération d'énergie à l'aide d'un {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} et d'un {THING:StructureTransformer}.

Un cousin éloigné de la jeep, le rover électrique Nv1 de {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} est l'un des véhicules légers les plus simples et durables de l'univers connu. Capable de transporter deux passagers et du fret tel que le {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} ou la {THING:Crate}, il est alimenté par jusqu'à trois batteries, acceptant tout, y compris la {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. Un groupe de quatre moteurs électriques montés sur le moyeu propulse le châssis en aluminium renforcé sur la plupart des terrains et modestes obstacles. Bien que le Nv1 soit conçu pour la stabilité dans des circonstances de faible horizontalité, s'il se renverse, essayez d'utiliser votre {THING:ItemCrowbar} pour le remettre à l'endroit.
Une {SLOT:GasCanister} isolé vide.
Règle le rapport de volume de liquide dans le tuyau liquide d'entrée. Cela est exprimé en pourcentage, où 100 est complètement plein et 0 est vide.
Lorsqu'il est connecté à l'alimentation et activé, il pompe le liquide d'un réseau liquide dans le monde.
Une entrée liquide passive au sol qui élimine rapidement les liquides dans une direction du monde vers le réseau de tuyaux connecté. Elle égalisera également les gaz avec l'atmosphère mondiale.

RecordThing.Value: Kit (Module d'Extraction de Gaz Automatisé pour Fusée)
RecordThing.Description: Ce kit crée un {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}.

RecordThing.Value: Module d'Extraction de Gaz Automatisé pour Fusée
RecordThing.Description: Dans le plus pur style {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, le module d'extraction de gaz A.R.M. est un ajout rapidement conçu à un système plus sophistiqué par une entreprise avec très peu de souci pour la sécurité ou la fiabilité. Le module stockera le gaz extrait dans un {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01} vide, tant qu'il est connecté par un {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} ou {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}.
Ce kit crée un {THING:StructureHeatExchangeLiquidtoGas}, un {THING:StructureHeatExchangerLiquidtoLiquid} et un {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas}.

Les spécifications originales de l'échangeur de chaleur de la série N Flow-P auraient été griffonnées au dos d'un reçu de burger par un designer {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} s'ennuyant en montant l'ascenseur spatial brésilien, mais cela ne l'a pas empêché de devenir l'un des designs d'échangeurs de chaleur les plus largement copiés du Système Solaire. Le 'N Flow-P' possède quatre connexions, vous permettant de faire passer deux réseaux liquides dans l'unité, qui travaille ensuite pour égaliser la température entre les deux réseaux distincts. Comme le N Flow-P est un système passif, il égalise la pression dans l'ensemble de chaque réseau individuel, sauf s'il est connecté à des dispositifs de gestion des liquides tels qu'une {THING:StructureLiquidVolumePump} ou un {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

Les spécifications originales de l'échangeur de chaleur de la série N Flow-P auraient été griffonnées au dos d'un reçu de burger par un designer {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} s'ennuyant en montant l'ascenseur spatial brésilien, mais cela ne l'a pas empêché de devenir l'un des designs d'échangeurs de chaleur les plus largement copiés du Système Solaire. Le 'N Flow-P' possède quatre connexions, vous permettant de faire passer deux réseaux gazeux dans l'unité, qui travaille ensuite pour égaliser la température entre les deux réseaux distincts. Comme le N Flow-P est un système passif, il égalise la pression dans l'ensemble de chaque réseau individuel, sauf s'il est connecté à des dispositifs de gestion des gaz tels qu'une {THING:StructureVolumePump} ou un {THING:StructureBackPressureRegulator}.

Les spécifications originales de l'échangeur de chaleur de la série N Flow-P auraient été griffonnées au dos d'un reçu de burger par un designer {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} s'ennuyant en montant l'ascenseur spatial brésilien, mais cela ne l'a pas empêché de devenir l'un des designs d'échangeurs de chaleur les plus largement copiés du Système Solaire. Le 'N Flow-P' possède quatre connexions, vous permettant de faire passer des réseaux liquides et gazeux distincts dans l'unité, qui travaille ensuite pour égaliser la température entre les deux réseaux distincts. Comme le N Flow-P est un système passif, il égalise la pression dans l'ensemble de chaque réseau individuel, sauf s'il est connecté à des dispositifs tels qu'une {THING:StructureVolumePump} ou un {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

RecordThing.Value: Échangeur de Chaleur Liquide et Gaz

RecordThing.Description:
L'{LINK:ODA;ODA} n'approuve pas les bandes sonores ni d'autres distractions. En conséquence, les {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} ont dû créer leur propre accompagnement musical pour le travail exigeant de construction et de maintenance d'infrastructures extraterrestres. Au cœur de ce passe-temps se trouve le séquenceur pas à pas, qui permet aux Stationeers de créer des motifs ou des boucles musicales courtes.
{HEADER:DIY MUSIC - GETTING STARTED}
1 : Connectez 8 {THING:DeviceStepUnit}s à votre séquenceur pas à pas via le port de données sur le côté gauche.
2 : Étiquetez chaque unité pas à pas, puis attribuez les unités pas à pas 1 à 8 sur le séquenceur pas à pas à l'aide du tournevis.
3 : Sélectionnez le haut-parleur de sortie (par exemple, {THING:PassiveSpeaker}) où le séquenceur jouera les sons. Cela doit être connecté au réseau logique sur le côté droit du séquenceur.
4 : Placez un {THING:StopWatch} et utilisez un {THING:StructureLogicReader} et un {THING:StructureLogicWriter} pour écrire le temps dans la variable de temps du séquenceur.
5 : Réglez les BPM sur le séquenceur à l'aide d'un {THING:StructureLogicDial} et d'un {THING:StructureLogicWriter} pour écrire dans la variable BPM du séquenceur. Un BPM plus élevé jouera la séquence plus rapidement.
6 : Insérez une cartouche sonore de votre choix et sélectionnez la variante sonore que vous souhaitez jouer en appuyant sur les boutons flèches situés au-dessus et en dessous de l'emplacement de la cartouche sonore.
7 : Choisissez la hauteur des sons à jouer en réglant le cadran sur chacune de vos 8 unités pas à pas à la note désirée. Avec les percussions, chaque note correspond à un son de batterie différent. Vous pouvez tester vos sons en appuyant sur le bouton d'activation de chaque unité pas à pas (lorsque le séquenceur est inactif).
8 : Amusez-vous avec le {THING:DeviceLfoVolume}.
9 : Enfin, activez le séquenceur, Vibeoneer.

RecordThing.Value: Unité Pas à Pas de Périphérique

RecordThing.Description:
Lorsque vos {LINK:OrganicPage;food} se décomposent, ils se transforment en ceci. Les scientifiques de {LINK:ODA;ODA} ont tenté de déterminer les constituants exacts de cette substance, mais elle reste insaisissable et mystérieuse. Il va sans dire que la manger est une mauvaise idée. Cependant, la recherche a déterminé que la vitesse exacte de décomposition varie individuellement en fonction de :
- TEMPÉRATURE - La réfrigération ralentira la décomposition, mais de nombreux aliments seront endommagés par une exposition à une pression extrêmement basse ainsi qu'à une chaleur extrême. La température optimale est de 0 kelvin (-272 C).
- TYPE D'ALIMENT - Chaque type d'{LINK:OrganicPage;food} a ses propres propriétés de décomposition. Par exemple, {THING:ItemTomatoSoup} dure beaucoup plus longtemps qu'un {THING:ItemTomato}.
- PRESSION - Les aliments se décomposent plus rapidement lorsque la pression tombe en dessous d'une atmosphère (101 kPa). La décomposition se produit de manière exponentiellement plus rapide à mesure que l'atmosphère approche le vide parfait. Il n'y a aucun effet des pressions plus élevées.
- ATMOSPHÈRE - Différents gaz peuvent ralentir ou accélérer le processus de décomposition. Le processus tiendra compte des ratios respectifs de gaz dans les atmosphères mélangées pour calculer le modificateur de décomposition. Les taux suivants s'appliquent à tous les aliments :
> {GAS:Oxygen} x 1.3 > {GAS:Nitrogen} x 0.6 > {GAS:CarbonDioxide} x 0.8 > {GAS:Volatiles} x 1 > {GAS:Pollutant} x 3 > {GAS:NitrousOxide} x 1.5 > {GAS:Steam} x 2 > Vide (voir PRESSION ci-dessus)
Une étagère pour mettre des choses dessus, afin de les voir.

L'oscillateur basse fréquence (OBF) rend tout sombre, tordu et croustillant en altérant la forme des ondes émises par un {THING:LogicStepSequencer8}.
Pour configurer un OBF :
1. Placez l'unité OBF. 2. Réglez la sortie OBF sur un {THING:PassiveSpeaker}. 3. Réglez la sortie d'un séquenceur sur OBF - ainsi, le signal du séquenceur passe par le OBF jusqu'à un haut-parleur. 4. Placez une {THING:StopWatch} ou utilisez-en une existante, puis utilisez un {THING:StructureLogicWriter} pour l'écrire dans le OBF. 5. Utilisez un autre écrivain logique pour écrire le BPM dans le OBF. 6. Vous êtes prêt. C'est le futur. Vous êtes dans l'espace. Rendez le son cool.
Pour plus d'informations, consultez la {LINK:MusicPage;page de musique}.

Le réfrigérateur Koolaid {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} est un dispositif de stockage auto-réfrigéré avec 15 emplacements qui préserve les aliments lorsqu'il est alimenté et allumé. Bien que de nombreux utilisateurs se soient plaints de l'emplacement de l'interrupteur d'alimentation, sa place dans le panthéon des appareils électroménagers extraterrestres est incontestée.
Avec sa propre atmosphère interne permanente, le réfrigérateur Koolaid ralentit la décomposition des {LINK:OrganicPage;food} en maintenant une température interne optimale. Sa consommation d'énergie varie en fonction de la température externe contre laquelle il doit équilibrer sa température interne. En conséquence, il doit dissiper la chaleur pour fonctionner, donc le réfrigérateur Koolaid NE FONCTIONNE PAS dans le vide.
De plus, ne laissez pas la porte ouverte, car elle s'égalisera avec la température actuelle du monde. Et peut-être qu'elle commencera à émettre un bip.
Pour plus d'informations sur la préservation des aliments, consultez la section {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} de la Stationpedia.
Ce kit crée un {THING:StructureFridgeBig}.

Essentiellement une boîte fortement isolée qui permet aux utilisateurs d'acheminer n'importe quelle atmosphère souhaitée, le réfrigérateur (Petit) {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} était une solution simple au problème de la {LINK:NutritionPage;food decay}. Il stocke un petit nombre d'articles, à la température que vous pouvez obtenir.
Pour plus d'informations sur la préservation des aliments, consultez la section {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} de la Stationpedia.

Le Distributeur automatique réfrigéré OmniKool est une version avancée du {THING:StructureVendingMachine} standard, qui maintient une pression optimale et une température constante de -130 degrés Celsius pour éviter la détérioration des aliments. Elle peut contenir jusqu'à 100 piles. L'OmniKool est également équipé d'un {THING:StructureStacker} intégré, permettant aux joueurs de définir la taille des piles pour tous les objets AJOUTÉS à l'appareil. La taille de pile par défaut de l'unité est de 50. NOTE : modifier les tailles de pile NE MET PAS À JOUR les piles existantes dans la machine, seulement celles ajoutées ultérieurement.
Cultiver une {THING:ItemPotato}.
Cultiver du {THING:ItemCorn}.
Cultiver du {THING:ItemWheat}.
Cultiver de la {THING:ItemTomato}.
Cultiver du {THING:ItemSoybean}.
Cultiver du {THING:ItemRice}.
Cultiver une {THING:ItemPumpkin}.
Cultiver une {THING:ItemFern}.
Cultiver un {THING:ItemMushroom}.

L'engrais modifie les processus de croissance des plantes et est créé par le composteur de base et le {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter} à l'aide de matière {LINK:OrganicPage;organique}. Les effets de l'engrais dépendent de ses ingrédients :
- Les {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} augmentent le RENDEMENT DES PLANTES jusqu'à deux fois - Les {THING:DecayedFood} accélèrent la VITESSE DE CROISSANCE des plantes jusqu'à deux fois - La {THING:ItemBiomass} augmente le NOMBRE DE CYCLES DE CROISSANCE pendant lesquels l'engrais est actif
L'effet de ces ingrédients dépend de leurs proportions respectives dans le composteur lorsque le traitement est activé.

Le composteur avancé transforme la matière organique en {THING:Fertilizer}. Il accepte les {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, les {THING:DecayedFood} ou la {THING:ItemBiomass}. Il nécessite de l'{GAS:Water} et de l'énergie pour fonctionner, accélérant ainsi le processus de compostage naturel. Lors du traitement, il libère de l'azote et des volatils, ainsi qu'une petite quantité de chaleur.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Le fertilisant est produit selon un rapport de 1:3 en termes de fertilisant par rapport aux ingrédients. Les effets du fertilisant sur les plantes varieront en fonction des proportions respectives de ses ingrédients.
- Les {LINK:OrganicPage;food} augmentent le RENDEMENT DES PLANTES jusqu'à deux fois - Les {THING:DecayedFood} accélèrent la VITESSE DE CROISSANCE des plantes jusqu'à deux fois - La {THING:ItemBiomass} augmente le NOMBRE DE CYCLES DE CROISSANCE pendant lesquels le fertilisant reste actif jusqu'à cinq fois
Crée un {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter}.
Crée un {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.
Une petite jardinière à des fins décoratives ou hydroponiques. Peut être connectée à {GAS:Water}, ou arrosée manuellement à l'aide d'une {THING:ItemWaterBottle} ou d'une {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater}.
Place une {THING:StructurePlanter}.

Un dispositif de compostage simple, le composteur de base transforme la matière organique en {THING:Fertilizer}. Il accepte les {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, les {THING:DecayedFood} ou la {THING:ItemBiomass}. Il nécessite un {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty} complet et une batterie pour fonctionner, accélérant ainsi le processus de compostage naturel. Lors du traitement, il libère de l'azote et des volatils, ainsi qu'une petite quantité de chaleur.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Le fertilisant est produit selon un rapport de 1:3 en termes de fertilisant par rapport aux ingrédients. Les effets du fertilisant sur les plantes varieront en fonction des proportions respectives de ses ingrédients.
- Les {LINK:OrganicPage;food} augmentent le RENDEMENT DES PLANTES jusqu'à deux fois - Les {THING:DecayedFood} accélèrent la VITESSE DE CROISSANCE des plantes jusqu'à deux fois - La {THING:ItemBiomass} augmente le NOMBRE DE CYCLES DE CROISSANCE pendant lesquels le fertilisant reste actif

La Machine d'Emballage Basique {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} nécessite des {THING:ItemEmptyCan} et des {LINK:OrganicPage;food} cuits pour créer une nourriture durable et facilement stockable. Notez que la Machine d'Emballage Basique doit être fixé à un {THING:StructureBench} pour l'alimentation, et n'accepte que les aliments cuits et les boîtes de conserve.
{HEADER:FONCTIONNEMENT}
1. Ajoutez les ingrédients appropriés dans l'appareil via la trémie en HAUT.
2. Fermez l'appareil en utilisant la poignée déroulante.
3. Activez l'appareil.
4. Retirez les conserves de la sortie à l'AVANT.
Remarque : la Machine d'Emballage Basique affichera une erreur sur son interrupteur d'activation si vous essayez de l'activer avant de le fermer.

Fabriquée dans une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} ou {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, en utilisant {THING:ItemCookedMushroom} et une {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, la soupe de champignons en conserve est assez nutritive et ne {LINK:DecayPage;se détériore} pas.
Œufs en poudre : la raison pour laquelle vous êtes allé dans l'espace.
Parce que l'espace serait nul sans elles.

Fabriquée dans une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} ou {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, en utilisant {THING:ItemCookedRice} et une {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, le riz au lait en conserve est une gourmandise sucrée, assez nutritive et ne {LINK:DecayPage;se détériore} pas.

Fabriquée dans une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} ou {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, en utilisant {THING:ItemCookedCondensedMilk} et une {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, le lait condensé en conserve est assez nutritif et ne {LINK:DecayPage;se détériore} pas.

Fabriqués dans une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} ou {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, en utilisant {THING:ItemCookedSoybean} et une {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, les haricots edamame en conserve sont assez nutritifs et ne {LINK:DecayPage;se détériorent} pas.

Fabriqués dans une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} ou {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, en utilisant {THING:ItemCookedPowderedEggs} et une {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, les œufs en poudre en conserve sont une nourriture excitante et dynamique, assez nutritive et ne {LINK:DecayPage;se détériorent} pas.

La Machine d'Emballage Avancée {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Multi-Plus Pro est une machine d'emballage automatisable qui utilise des {THING:ItemEmptyCan}s et des {LINK:OrganicPage;aliments} cuits pour créer des aliments en conserve qui ne se détériorent pas. Notez que la MEA ne prend en charge que les aliments cuits et les boîtes de conserve en fer-blanc.
Crée une {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}.
Un aliment cuit riche en nutriments, qui peut être mis en conserve.
Un aliment cuit riche en nutriments, qui peut être mis en conserve.

Un anthurium, évolué dans les jungles d'Amérique du Sud, qui tolère des températures plus élevées que la plupart des plantes.
Un joli lys avec une plus grande résistance aux températures froides.
Une des nombreuses fougères de l'univers, utile dans une gamme de recettes médicinales et organiques.
Une fougère adaptée par {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} pour transformer un volume beaucoup plus grand de {GAS:CarbonDioxide} en {GAS:Oxygen} que la moyenne des plantes.
Tuyauterie de liquide avec très peu de perte ou de gain de température.
Tuyauterie de liquide avec très peu de perte ou de gain de température.
Tuyauterie de liquide avec très peu de perte ou de gain de température.
